answers.answer: A pound is a tad bit excessive, hunny. Keep in mind 16 oz is a pound...if your baby is between 10-12 oz right now that's perfect!
AND a real pregnancy is 10 months. Not 9. So your doctor maybe going based on 10 months. Not 9.
Im 22w+4d and my baby os 1lb 1oz! They said shes perfectly healthy:)

I'm due January 25th with a boy too!! :) I went in last Friday for my anatomy scan & at the time I was 20w6d and my baby boy was estimated at weighing 13oz. But I wouldn't but concerned, 11oz is normal. And congrats! :)

yea I'm happy he is healthy I'm just a lil worried bcuz he is 5ounces smaller I have a feeling he is going to be small I only gained 5pounds since I been pregnant I'm now 114 but all my mom kids was small I was 5lb and my lil sister was 4 and the youngest was only 3 lbs
aww congrats y'all ugh I can't wait till next year when we get to meet our bundle of joy only 4more months to go thank God! :)
I'm 27+2 and my baby just now weighs about 2 pounds so I would not worry at all. When I went in at 18 weeks he weighed 8oz. So I think your baby is completely normal :)

All people come in different shapes and sizes. Don't worry. Doctors get on my nerves sometimes because if a baby is on the exact dot they freak the mother out 11 ounces isn't that bad. If the baby was 8 or below then worry. BTW ultrasounds aren't always right. I was told my first son was going to be 3 pounds when born he was actually 4 lbs 12ozs  I had preeclampsia so he had to come early. All babies are different and grow at different speeds.

At 22 weeks exactly my baby girl was measuring 9oz and they told me she was small. I went back and had another scan at 26 weeks and she was already 2 pounds, 4oz. I wouldn't worry too much. At 21 weeks, 11oz sounds very normal to me. Every baby is different and ultrasound machines can be wayyy off on weight estimates. Im sure your baby is just fine.

thanks mommies you all sure put me at ease especially to no the doctors is not always right and to no 11ounces not that bad I guess I was really nervous bcuz I heard you don't get that many ultrasounds unless you like high risk and I had so many all ready but I be happy to see him so I'm kind of happy they are doing another 1 especially since they said he's healthy that's the main thing

question: does anyone remember how much their baby weigh at 21weeks I went for my anatomy scan yesterday I am 21+3 I'm due jan 25 now I have to go back for another ultrasound in 4 weeks bcuz she said my baby is small he is 11ounces and that's measuring that I'm due in feb. but she is still going to keep my due date jan.25 on this app for 21weeks it say the baby should be around 10.5ounces but a book I have says he should be a 1pound I am a ftm so this is very new to me
